00018 /* Behaviors such as Evade, Chase, Self Destruction, ChangingBehavior... are still not implemented */
00019 namespace BulletHell.Game.Library.Behavior
00020 {
00021     public class BehaviorController : Behavior
00022     {
00023         private BehaviorState lastBehavior = BehaviorState.BehaviorController;
00024         private bool shootable = false,
00025             shootableCheck = false;
00026 
00027         private float chaseDistance = (_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width + _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height) / 6,
00028             evadeDistance = (_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width + _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height) / 6,
00029             selfDestructDistance = (_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width + _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height) / 4,
00030             hysteresis = 50,
00031             lastDistance = 0, // the distance computed last update
00032             distance = 0,
00033             xDistance = 0, // positive = hero is left of parent
00034             yDistance = 0; // negative = hero is in front of parent
00035 
00036         private TimeEventHandler timer;
00037 
00038         public BehaviorController(EnemyPlaneObj parent)
00039             : base(parent)
00040         {
00041             behaviorState = BehaviorState.BehaviorController;
00042             timer = new TimeEventHandler();
00043         }
00044 
00045         public override Behavior clone(EnemyPlaneObj newParent)
00046         {
00047             return new BehaviorController(newParent);
00048         }
00049 
00050         /* Checks to see if the parent has the ability to shoot */
00051         private bool canShoot(List<Behavior> behaviors)
00052         {
00053             if (!shootableCheck)
00054                 shootable = firstBehaviorfirstGet(behaviors, BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00055                     BehaviorState.ShootStraight,
00056                     BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00057                     BehaviorState.ShootTarget) != null;
00058 
00059             return shootable;
00060         }
00061 
00062         /* checks the condition for a given behavior, easier to manage as these condition are used in multiple places */
00063         private bool checkBehavior(List<Behavior> behaviors, BehaviorState target)
00064         {
00065             switch (target)
00066             {
00067                 case BehaviorState.SelfDestruct:
00068                     return (distance < selfDestructDistance);
00069 
00070                 case BehaviorState.Shoot:
00071                     return (parent.Timer.elapsedMilliseconds() > parent.BulletType[parent.bulletSelection].BulletInterval)
00072                     && canShoot(parent.Behaviors);
00073 
00074                 case BehaviorState.Evade:
00075                     return (distance < evadeDistance - hysteresis);
00076 
00077                 case BehaviorState.Chase:
00078                     return (distance > chaseDistance + hysteresis);
00079             }
00080 
00081             return false;
00082         }
00083 
00084         private Behavior routineA()
00085         {
00086             List<BehaviorState> behaviors = new List<BehaviorState>();
00087 
00088             if (lastDistance - distance > 0) // hero is coming
00089             {
00090                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.SelfDestruct))
00091                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.SelfDestruct);
00092 
00093                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Shoot))
00094                 {
00095                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Shoot);
00096                     parent.Timer.reset();
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Evade))
00100                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Evade);
00101 
00102                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Chase))
00103                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Chase);
00104 
00105                 return firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors, behaviors.ToArray());
00106             }
00107             else // hero is leaving
00108             {
00109                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.SelfDestruct))
00110                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.SelfDestruct);
00111 
00112                 if (distance > chaseDistance + hysteresis)
00113                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Chase);
00114 
00115                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Shoot))
00116                 {
00117                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Shoot);
00118                     parent.Timer.reset();
00119                 }
00120 
00121                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Evade))
00122                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Evade);
00123 
00124                 return firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors, behaviors.ToArray());
00125             }
00126         }
00127 
00128         private Behavior routineB()
00129         {
00130             List<BehaviorState> behaviors = new List<BehaviorState>();
00131 
00132             if (lastDistance - distance > 0) // hero is coming
00133             {
00134                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Evade))
00135                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Evade);
00136 
00137                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Shoot))
00138                 {
00139                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Shoot);
00140                     parent.Timer.reset();
00141                 }
00142 
00143                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.SelfDestruct))
00144                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.SelfDestruct);
00145 
00146                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Chase))
00147                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Chase);
00148 
00149                 return firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors, behaviors.ToArray());
00150             }
00151             else // hero is leaving
00152             {
00153                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Chase))
00154                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Chase);
00155 
00156                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Shoot))
00157                 {
00158                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Shoot);
00159                     parent.Timer.reset();
00160                 }
00161 
00162                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.SelfDestruct))
00163                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.SelfDestruct);
00164 
00165                 if (checkBehavior(parent.Behaviors, BehaviorState.Evade))
00166                     behaviors.Add(BehaviorState.Evade);
00167 
00168                 return firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors, behaviors.ToArray());
00169             }
00170         }
00171 
00172         private void controlBehavior(Map map, GameTime gameTime)
00173         {
00174             PlaneObj target = map.hero;
00175             Behavior behavior = null;
00176 
00177             foreach (Behavior b in parent.Behaviors)
00178             {
00179                 /* If the object has waypoints to go, ignore other behaviors; waypoints are prioritized */
00180                 if (b.behaviorState == BehaviorState.LinearBehavior)
00181                 {
00182                     if (parent.Path.Count > 0)
00183                         behavior = b;
00184                 }
00185             }
00186 
00187             if (behavior == null)
00188             {
00189                 /* These if-statements can be reduced, but this is more readable. At lease, for me it is. */
00190                 if (yDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is in the back
00191                 {
00192                     if (xDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6 || xDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6) // hero is left or right of parent
00193                         behavior = routineB();
00194                     else // hero is nearby
00195                         behavior = routineA();
00196                 }
00197                 else if (yDistance <= _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6 && yDistance >= -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is nearby
00198                     behavior = routineA();
00199                 else if (yDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is in the front
00200                     behavior = routineB();
00201             }
00202             else 
00203             {
00204                 /* if the hero has waypoints to move, but it can shoot as well. Shooting is prioritized */
00205                 if (parent.Timer.elapsedMilliseconds() > parent.BulletType[parent.bulletSelection].BulletInterval)
00206                 {
00207                     foreach (Behavior b in parent.Behaviors)
00208                         if (b.behaviorState == BehaviorState.Shoot && canShoot(parent.Behaviors))
00209                             behavior = b;
00210 
00211                     parent.Timer.reset();
00212                 }
00213             }
00214 
00215             if (behavior != null)
00216             {
00217                 if (_GLOBAL.Debug)
00218                     Console.WriteLine(behavior.ToString());
00219 
00220                 behavior.Update(map, gameTime);
00221                 lastBehavior = behavior.behaviorState;
00222             }
00223         }
00224 
00225         internal override void Update(Map map, GameTime gameTime)
00226         {
00227             timer.Update(gameTime);
00228             if (timer.elapsedMilliseconds() > 50)
00229             {
00230                 distance = Vector2.Distance(parent.position, map.hero.position);
00231                 xDistance = parent.X - map.hero.X;
00232                 yDistance = parent.Y - map.hero.Y;
00233 
00234                 controlBehavior(map, gameTime);
00235 
00236                 timer.reset();
00237                 lastDistance = distance;
00238             }
00239         }
00240     }
00241 }
